name: Reddit Sliding Sidebar
description:
Makes the reddit side bar slide in and out when you're not using it.

Google Chrome Users: If the sidebar is used, you type into the search bar or a do a page search and it finds something in the side bar the page will scroll to view the side bar. I cannot, as far as I can see, fix this easily while still being able to view the sidebar while it is slid in and it is not an issue on firefox.

If you come across this issue you can scroll back using middle mouse scrolling or by hovering your mouse over the sidebar.
additional_info: 1.5.1: Because being able to click on things is important. 1.5: Changed the way the sliding menu works, rather than positioning it uses negative margins on either the right or left side if it is not opened. This should make it a lot more compatible for subreddits that use absolutely positioned elements like r/mylittlelistentothis or any subreddit with a banner. 1.4: Disabled for r/mylittlelistentothis because it completely breaks the sub under its new style, thanks for the regex by the way Phei. 1.3: Fix for sliding bar appearing under ads, thank you Parasprite and sorry for the delay. 1.2: Fixed some typos for animation. Disabled search bar work around, it's not needed for firefox and chrome still suffers the issue. 1.1: Fixes for r/masseffect made some notifications appear in the sidebar rather than off screen. 1.0: Initial release
